intro: Miconia anderssonii, commonly known as the Andes miconia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces showy, white to pinkish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which attract various pollinators. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets. Due to its invasive potential in some regions, it is sometimes considered a problematic species in ecological contexts.
